To evaluate the water quality situation, the incidence of water pollution was further explored. A single-factor evaluation method was chosen as the water quality evaluation method. The indicators for the assessment are TN and TP. For the unified analysis, the surface water is considered contaminated with TN and TP concentration greater than Class IV in the Environmental Quality Standards for Surface Water (GB3838-2002). The thresholds of TN and TP are 1.5 mg/L and 0.3 mg/L, respectively. Equation (3) calculates the incidence of water pollution.
